title: Beacon backfilling failed err="missing beacon header xxx"
body:
Hello there.
I need help. It seems to be my node's problem; geth client is not wrong.

Version:
- Geth: v1.10.23
- prysm: v3.1.1

I raised the prysm version of a working node from 3.1.0 to 3.1.1 (I did not create a new node).
When performing the upgrade, I terminated the Geth and prysm processes once. And after restarting the processes, I keep getting the following log and Geth's block synchronization does not proceed.

Please let me know the cause and how the node can resume block synchronization.

Logs:
```
INFO [09-13|07:01:12.983] State heal in progress accounts=0@0.00B slots=0@0.00B codes=33@223.91KiB nodes=37394@12.70MiB pending=1
INFO [09-13|07:01:12.990] Forkchoice requested sync to new head number=12,978,281 hash=53d6cb..4e3ba8
ERROR[09-13|07:01:12.993] Beacon backfilling failed err="missing beacon header 12864481"
```

Yeah looks like your database is corrupted due to you terminating the process. You can try `geth removdb` and keep the ancients. This will force your node to restart the sync and save some time over fully scrapping the node

Thank you for your response.
I tried to try `geth removedb`, but it was not possible while geth was running, so restarting the instance solved the problem.

I think I got the same issue after an unexpected power loss
[sync.log](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/9637693/sync.log)
after that, I tried `geth removed` and keep the ancients, but I still got "Forkchoice requested sync to new head" logs in syncing. I want to know is it normal?

```
Sep 24 00:39:01 eth geth[959]: INFO [09-24|00:39:01.303] Imported new chain segment               blocks=9     txs=2137      mgas=161.013 elapsed=9.310s  mgasps=17.295 number=15,513,113 hash=01e8d3..b32f34 age=1w5d19h dirty=592.17MiB
```
